description.narrative: The core technology to be supported will be the production of organic compost to be generated from waste at the household level and at municipal landfills, augmented by decomposition technology at landfills to reduce methane emissions.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Output 1: Enhanced knowledge of the local community on the SWM sector and potential for livelihood opportunities in the value chain. 1.1- Number of key stakeholders that are identified and participate in awareness activities representing local authorities, private sectors and NGOs disaggregated by gender (at least 30 women). 1.2- Number of key stakeholders surveyed on willingness to participate in the compostable waste collection process. 1.3 - Number of awareness campaigns designed and conducted. Output 2: Enhanced capacities of local authorities on composting and waste management 2.1- Number of staff working with waste management trained on organic waste handling and composting techniques. Output 3: Business modality of compost production and marketing approaches are developed. 3.1- Number of market supply and demand studies completed. 3.2- A national strategy for promoting waste to compost developed. 3.3- Number of awareness events on economic benefits for organic compost conducted. Output 4: Construction a pilot composting facility implemented and maintained. 4.1- Progress phase of pilot composting plant from preliminary design, testing and final design. 4.2- Number of technical and economic evaluations completed on composting plant products in M3 and M4.

comment.narrative: Output 1: Enhanced knowledge of the local community on the SWM sector and potential for livelihood opportunities in the value chain. 1.1- 50 key stakeholders identified and participate in awareness activities representing local authorities, private sectors and NGOs (disaggregated by gender). 1.2- 50 stakeholders (i.e. camp operators, NGOs, hotels, and community influencers) surveyed . 1.3- 2 awareness campaign designed and conducted. Output 2: Enhanced capacities of local authorities on composting and waste management. 2.1- 25 staff working with waste management trained on organic waste handling and composting techniques (gender disaggregated, based on available staff). Output 3: Business modality of compost production and marketing approaches are developed. 3.1 - 1 market supply and demand study completed. 3.1- 1 National strategy developed. 3.3- 2 awareness events on economic benefits for organic compost conducted. Output 4: Construction a pilot composting facility implemented and maintained. 4.1- 1 Report on best practices and final commercially feasible design determined. 4.2- 2 technical and economic evaluations completed on composting plant products in M3 and M4.

Updated 16 Nov 2021: Output 1: Enhanced knowledge of the local community on the SWM sector and potential for livelihood opportunities in the value chain. 1.1- 50 key stakeholders identified and and invited to participate in awareness activities representing local authorities, private sectors and NGOs (disaggregated by gender). 1.2- 50 stakeholders (i.e. camp operators, NGOs, hotels, and community influencers) surveyed . 1.3- 2 awareness campaign designed
Output 2: Enhanced capacities of local authorities on composting and waste management. 2.1- 25 staff working with waste management trained on organic waste handling and composting techniques (30 % women).
Output 3: Business modality of compost production and marketing approaches are developed. 3.1- 1 draft market supply and demand study completed. 3.2- 1 draft National strategy developed. 3.3- 2 awareness events on economic benefits for organic compost have been designed
Output 4: Construction a pilot composting facility implemented and maintained. 4.1- Zero (Pilot composting site design and procurement process in final stage). 4.2- Zero (Pilot composting site design and procurement process in final stage).
